title: 50 First Dates
review: I'm a big fan of Adam Sandler's movies, they're always hilarious. Maybe it's something about his egg-shaped head, I don't know, but he's a laugh. He played the leading role of Henry Roth, with Drew Barrymore starring as Lucy Whitmore. These two fit their rolls perfectly throughout a series of unforgettable (or not so unforgettable) scenes, struggling in an amusing yet romantic way, making their way through the ups and downs of their situation.Lucy's father and muscle-obsessed brother were a kind and caring family to Lucy. And although they had good intentions, without the love and devotion of Henry Roth, Lucy would still be at the Pancake house, constructing miniature waffles houses, maintaining the firm belief that it is her father's birthday, that day, and the next day, and the next day...My Rating - 8.0/10
